DOC.brief_summary: Rationale : Undernutrition risk among community-dwelling older adult develop country show around 24 % . Increasing protein intake strategy feasible well efficacious reduce undernutrition community-dwelling older adult . A promising strategy increase protein intake among old adult , offer dietary solution normal food fit current daily eating pattern . For reason , home-delivered protein-rich readymade meal protein-rich dairy product study research . Objective : The primary objective study effectiveness commercially available protein-rich readymade meal protein-rich dairy product increase protein intake old adult use meal-delivery service level 1.2 g/kg bodyweight/d . Secondary objective include : studying effect meal dairy product total daily energy intake . Further , study acceptance compliance meal dairy product . Study design : The study perform single-blind randomized , control , four-week trial real-life setting : community-dwelling older adult ' home . Study population : The target group study community-dwelling older adult use meal-delivery service . Intervention : Both group receive readymade meal day 4 week . They also receive dairy product freely consume intervention period . The intervention group receive protein-rich meal protein-rich dairy product , control receive standard meal food product . Main study parameters/endpoints : Difference daily protein intake intervention control group . Secondary parameter : energy intake acceptance ( like ) .
DOC.brief_title: Increase Protein Intake Older Meal Service Clients With Readymade Protein-rich Meals Foods
